name: Fragments of the Past
description: In order to make his celebration a success, Lieutenant Sahil has decided to open an exhibit of historically and culturally relevant items from across the galaxy. Gather these items and ensure they remain secure.
rules:
-- Unique Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Ancient Humanoid, Patar, Data, Lieutenant Sahil or Cultural Figure Crew will provide a bonus to Supply Missions.
-- Every Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are only available during Phase 1. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Ancient Humanoid, Patar, Data, Lieutenant Sahil or Cultural Figure Crew
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Supply Missions!

featured_crew.name: K'mpec
featured_crew.flavor: K'mpec was the Klingon Chancellor, ready for anything to keep peace in the Klingon Empire.

action.name: The Empire Will Not Be Destroyed

featured_crew.name: Patar
featured_crew.flavor: Patar believed that turning control over decision-making to artificial intelligence would help avoid threats in the future.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: K'mpec
rewards.flavor: K'mpec was the Klingon Chancellor, ready for anything to keep peace in the Klingon Empire.

rewards.name: Patar
rewards.flavor: Patar believed that turning control over decision-making to artificial intelligence would help avoid threats in the future.

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

goals.flavor: Keep the event in order with the Dominion.
Ensure there will be no trickery with the Romulans.
Track artifacts across the galaxy with the Borg.

screens.text: "Captain, I appreciate your interest in our celebration. Everything seems to be coming along nicely. My hope now is to gather cultural artifacts to put on display."
"I am rather curious to see the material fruits of our genetic descendants' labors."
"I am doubtful you will obtain anything of significance. What is your security strategy? How would you keep these artifacts safe and still make them available to the public?"
"What is the old saying, Captain? 'Where there's a will, there's a way'? What do you say? Are you up for the challenge?"
"Captain, I appreciate your interest in our celebration. Everything seems to be coming along nicely. My hope now is to gather cultural artifacts to put on display."
"I am rather curious to see the material fruits of our genetic descendants' labors."
"I am doubtful you will obtain anything of significance. What is your security strategy? How would you keep these artifacts safe and still make them available to the public?"
"What is the old saying, Captain? 'Where there's a will, there's a way'? What do you say? Are you up for the challenge?"
"Excellent work, Captain. Your security plan will be instrumental in convincing the various factions to temporarily part with their artifacts."

responses.text: "They serve as physical testaments to a people's history and culture."
"They are tools to be used against the sentimental."
"They're inanimate objects, lacking the memories and knowledge of sentient beings."

screens.text: "Agreed. I even find myself more at ease seeing what you've come up with. Let me ask you something, Captain, just as a curiosity. What do you believe to be the relevance of cultural artifacts?"

"A sentiment I share. When our time was at hand, we were at a loss with how to connect with those who would come after us. Artifacts can often serve as their own records and messages for our descendants."
"Crass, but I wouldn't necessarily disagree. Attachment to material goods, even those with the weight of tradition, can all too easily create an opening by which one might be controlled."

"Indeed. And yet, the significance many species assign to their artifacts aligns with their attachment to their past. I lack the sort of past or attachment that humans, for example, possess. But in some way, that attachment in itself feels human."

"Interesting to consider. Even the difference in what is considered valuable and why shows the variety between all of us. Your security plan is sure to instill confidence, Captain. I'm counting on you to make our exhibit a success."
"Excellent work, Captain. Your security plan will be instrumental in convincing the various factions to temporarily part with their artifacts."

responses.text: "They serve as physical testaments to a people's history and culture."
"They are tools to be used against the sentimental."
"They're inanimate objects, lacking the memories and knowledge of sentient beings."
